CatDescriptText: Image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1946, pg. 3, in "Public Opinion" column, with question: "The Courier's Inquiring Reporter, on a brief tour of Hill District bars this week, found that local mixologists of color, had mixed feelings when approached with the question: 'Do you think that local Negro bartenders should affiliate themselves with organized labor?" Image cutline reads: "Claude Delaney, 2124 Elmore Square, Rosen's Bar and Grill at 2015 Centre Avenue: 'Personally speaking, I don't see why not.  If you have a group and you don't stick together, it doesn't mean a thing, and can't stand for anything.  That's the way I feel about it, and I think that we should affiliate ourselves with labor, as recognized bartenders."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of bartender Claude Delaney, posed with hand resting on Seeburg mini-jukebox, in Rosen's Bar and Grill with three pictures of boxing scenes, and advertisements for Hanley's Ale and Old Overholt whiskey
